meanings.definition: To distribute or set aside for a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will allocate different tasks to each student for the project.
meanings.sent2: It is important to allocate enough time for studying before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to allocate all the ingredients for making the special dish.
meanings.sent4: The captain had to allocate the limited fuel wisely to reach the destination.
meanings.sent5: The company will allocate funds for the new marketing campaign next month.

meanings.definition: To assign or designate for a particular use.
meanings.sent1: Please allocate a specific room for the meeting tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The manager will allocate different shifts to the employees based on their availability.
meanings.sent3: The aliens decided to allocate the spaceship for intergalactic travel.
meanings.sent4: The architect will allocate the space in the building for the new art gallery.
meanings.sent5: The farmer needs to allocate the land for planting crops in the spring.

meanings.sent1: The government will allocate funds for improving the infrastructure.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to allocate manpower efficiently during emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to allocate his magic wand for performing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The team leader needs to allocate the budget wisely for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent5: The charity organization will allocate donations to various causes.
